elements.title: The One (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The One (pictured), a private residence in Los Angeles, has 21 bedrooms, 42 bathrooms, a 30-car garage, a four-lane bowling alley, a casino, a nightclub, and five swimming pools including a moat?

elements.title: Mary Lake Polan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that gynecologist Mary Lake Polan wrote a medical mystery novel to "demystify" the procedures behind in vitro fertilisation?

elements.title: Ethics (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in his Ethics, Peter Abelard argued that infidels who sincerely believe themselves to be honouring God are not guilty of sin?

elements.title: Lord Duthie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Scottish judge Lord Duthie served as an officer in the Royal Naval Reserve?

elements.title: first election in Baden in which women could vote (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first election in Baden in which women could vote resulted in nine women being elected to the state legislature?

elements.title: Lucy Tun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the alt-pop musician Lucy Tun cites death metal and RuPaul's Drag Race as influences?

elements.title: a happy ending (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rob Thomas always planned to give iZombie a happy ending?

elements.title: Cam Little (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that placekicker Cam Little donated money to a Down syndrome organization for every field goal he made?
